column1: '''Dol Tarlang''' was the northernmost of three peaks (the other two being [[Cûl Bîn]] and [[Cûl Veleg]]) located in the pass of [[Tarlang's Neck]]. The three mountains formed a spur on the southern side of the [[White Mountains]].

column2: Dol Tarlang was in origin the head of the [[giants|giant]] [[Tarlang]].<ref name=N>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column3: ''[[Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings|Nomenclature of The Lord of the Rings]]''
column4: omitted entry quoted in [[Wayne G. Hammond]]
column6: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]''

column1: The name ''Dol Tarlang'' is glossed as "Tarlang's Head"
column2: <ref name=N/> consisting of ''[[dol]]'' ("head") and ''[[Tarlang#Etymology|Tarlang]]''.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://thainsbook.net/mountains.html|articlename=Mountains of Middle-earth: Dol Tarlang
column3: Cûl Veleg & Cûl Bîn|dated=|website=[http://thainsbook.net/ The Thain's Book]|accessed=19 February 2013}}</ref>
